SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.model

Class LittleModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.model.LittleModel
public class LittleModel extends Object
The LittleModel class is responsible for maintaining a simplified version of the game model in server. It stores information about the game such as points, resources, cards, and other game details. The class provides methods to update and retrieve this information. The LittleModel class uses several HashMaps to store information about points, resources, and cards. It also uses arrays to store information about the player's cards and the common table. The LittleModel class uses a Deck object for each type of card deck in the game. These decks are used to retrieve card information based on card IDs. The LittleModel class provides methods to update the game state, such as updating the player's hand, updating the card on the table, updating the score, updating the resources, and updating the common table. It also provides methods to retrieve information about the game state, such as getting the player's hand, getting the hidden hand of other players, getting the points, getting the resources, and getting the cards on the common table.

  • Constructor Details

    • LittleModel

      public LittleModel()
      The LittleModel constructor initializes the points, resources, myCards, otherPlayersCards, and table HashMaps. It also initializes the startingCardsDeck, objectiveCardsDeck, resourceCardsDeck, and goldCardsDeck.

    • LittleModel

      public LittleModel(String path)
      The LittleModel constructor initializes the points, resources, myCards, otherPlayersCards, and table HashMaps. It also initializes the startingCardsDeck, objectiveCardsDeck, resourceCardsDeck, and goldCardsDeck.

    • LittleModel

      public LittleModel(HashMap<String,Integer> points, HashMap<String,HashMap<Sign,Integer>> resources, Integer[] myCards, HashMap<String,javafx.util.Pair<Kingdom,Boolean>[]> otherPlayersCards, HashMap<String,CardClient> table, Integer[] resourceCards, Integer[] goldCards, Kingdom headDeckGold, Kingdom headDeckResource, Integer[] secretObjectiveCardsToChoose, Integer[] commonObjectiveCards, Integer secretObjectiveCard)
      Updates the common table in the game. This method is used to update the common table with the new set of resource cards, gold cards, and the head decks for both types of cards. The resource cards and gold cards are represented by Integer arrays where each Integer is the ID of a card. The head decks are represented by Kingdom objects.
      Parameters:
      points - A HashMap representing the points of the players
      resources - A HashMap representing the resources of the players
      myCards - An array of Integers representing the IDs of the cards in the
      otherPlayersCards - A Pair representing the cards of others players
      table - A Hashmap representing the starting Card of players
      resourceCards - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      goldCards - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      headDeckGold - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      headDeckResource - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      secretObjectiveCardsToChoose - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      commonObjectiveCards - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold
      secretObjectiveCard - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold

  • Method Details

    • updatePrivateHand

      public void updatePrivateHand(Integer[] hand)
      Updates the player's hand with the given array of card IDs. The cards are represented by their IDs in the form of an Integer array.
      Parameters:
      hand - An array of Integers representing the IDs of the cards in the player's hand.

    • getHand

      public Integer[] getHand()
      Returns the player's hand as an array of card IDs. The cards are represented by their IDs in the form of an Integer array.
      Returns:
      An array of Integers representing the IDs of the cards in the player's hand.

    • getCardInHand

      public Integer getCardInHand(int index)
      This method is used to retrieve a card from the player's hand based on its index. The cards in the hand are represented by an array of Integers, where each Integer is the ID of a card.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      An Integer representing the ID of the card at the given index in the player's hand.

    • setCardInHand

      public void setCardInHand(int index, Integer cardId)
      This method is used to set a card in the player's hand at a specific index. The cards in the hand are represented by an array of Integers, where each Integer is the ID of a card.
      Parameters:
      index - The index at which to set the card in the player's hand.
      cardId - The ID of the card to be set in the player's hand.

    • updateHiddenHand

      public void updateHiddenHand(String nickname, javafx.util.Pair<Kingdom,Boolean>[] hand)
      Updates the hidden hand of the specified player. The cards are represented by a Pair array where each Pair consists of a Kingdom and a Boolean.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose hand is to be updated.
      hand - An array of Pairs representing the Kingdom and visibility of the cards in the player's hand.

    • getHiddenHand

      public javafx.util.Pair<Kingdom,Boolean>[] getHiddenHand(String player)
      Returns the hidden hand of the specified player. The cards are represented by a Pair array where each Pair consists of a Kingdom and a Boolean.
      Parameters:
      player - The nickname of the player whose hand is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An array of Pairs representing the Kingdom and visibility of the cards in the player's hand.

    • updateCardOnTable

      public void updateCardOnTable(Integer newCardId, boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck)
      Updates the card on the table. The card is represented by its ID in the form of an Integer.
      Parameters:
      newCardId - The ID of the new card.
      gold - A boolean indicating if the card is a gold card.
      onTableOrDeck - An integer indicating the position of the card on the table or deck.

    • updateHeadDeck

      public void updateHeadDeck(Kingdom headDeck, boolean gold)
      Updates the head deck. This method is used to update the head deck with the new Kingdom. The Kingdom is represented by an enumeration.
      Parameters:
      headDeck - The new Kingdom for the head deck.
      gold - A boolean indicating if the head deck is for gold cards.

    • updateScore

      public void updateScore(String nickname, int points)
      Updates the score of the specified player. This method is used to update the score of a player with the new score.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose score is to be updated.
      points - The new score for the player.

    • getPoints

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getPoints()
      Returns the points of all players in the game. This method is used to retrieve the current points of all players. The points are represented in a HashMap where the key is the player's nickname and the value is the player's points.
      Returns:
      A HashMap representing the nicknames of the players and their corresponding points.

    • updatePlaceCard

      public void updatePlaceCard(String nickname, int id, Point position, boolean side, int turn)
      Updates the placement of a card for a specific player. This method is used to update the placement of a card on the player's board. The card is identified by its ID, and its position is represented by a Point object. The side of the card and the turn in which the card was placed are also recorded.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player who placed the card.
      id - The ID of the card.
      position - The position of the card on the player's board.
      side - The side of the card (true for gold side, false for resource side).
      turn - The turn in which the card was placed.

    • updateResources

      public void updateResources(String nickname, HashMap<Sign,Integer> resources)
      Updates the resources of the specified player. This method is used to update the resources of a player with the new set of resources. The resources are represented by a HashMap where the key is the Sign and the value is the quantity of that resource.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose resources are to be updated.
      resources - A HashMap representing the resources and their quantities for the player.

    • getResources

      public HashMap<String,HashMap<Sign,Integer>> getResources()
      Returns the resources of all players in the game. This method is used to retrieve the current resources of all players. The resources are represented in a HashMap where the key is the player's nickname and the value is another HashMap representing the resources and their quantities.
      Returns:
      A HashMap representing the nicknames of the players and their corresponding resources.

    • getObjectiveCard

      public ObjectiveCard getObjectiveCard(int id)
      Returns the IDs of the objective cards in the game. This method is used to retrieve the current IDs of the objective cards. The IDs are represented in an Integer array.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the objective card.
      Returns:
      An array of Integers representing the IDs of the objective cards.

    • getStartingCard

      public PlayedCard getStartingCard(int id, boolean side)
      Returns a PlayedCard object representing a starting card. This method is used to retrieve a starting card based on its ID and side. The ID is adjusted by subtracting 97 to match the index in the startingCardsDeck.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the starting card.
      side - The side of the card (true for gold side, false for resource side).
      Returns:
      A PlayedCard object representing the starting card.

    • getCard

      public PlayedCard getCard(int id, boolean side)
      Returns a PlayedCard object representing a card. This method is used to retrieve a card based on its ID and side. If the ID is greater than or equal to 97, it is considered a starting card and the getStartingCard method is called. If the ID is less than 57, it is considered a resource card and is retrieved from the resourceCardsDeck. Otherwise, it is considered a gold card and is retrieved from the goldCardsDeck.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the card.
      side - The side of the card (true for gold side, false for resource side).
      Returns:
      A PlayedCard object representing the card.

    • updateCommonTable

      public void updateCommonTable(Integer[] resourceCards, Integer[] goldCards, Kingdom resourceCardOnDeck, Kingdom goldCardOnDeck)
      Updates the common table in the game. This method is used to update the common table with the new set of resource cards, gold cards, and the head decks for both types of cards. The resource cards and gold cards are represented by Integer arrays where each Integer is the ID of a card. The head decks are represented by Kingdom objects.
      Parameters:
      resourceCards - An array of Integers representing the IDs of the resource cards on the table.
      goldCards - An array of Integers representing the IDs of the gold cards on the table.
      resourceCardOnDeck - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of resource cards.
      goldCardOnDeck - A Kingdom object representing the head deck of gold cards.

      Parameters:
      indexCard - The index of the secret objective card in the secretObjectiveCardsToChoose array.

      public void updateUsers(HashMap<String,Color> playersAndPins)

    • getOtherPlayersCards

      public HashMap<String,javafx.util.Pair<Kingdom,Boolean>[]> getOtherPlayersCards()
      Returns the hidden hands of all other players in the game. This method is used to retrieve the hidden hands of all other players in the game. The hands are represented by a HashMap where the key is the player's nickname, and the value is an array of Pairs representing the Kingdom and visibility of the cards in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      A HashMap representing the nicknames of the players and their corresponding hidden hands.

    • getListOfCards

      public ArrayList<CardClient> getListOfCards(String nickname)
      Returns a list of CardClient objects for the TUI. This method is used to retrieve a list of CardClient objects for the TUI. The list is generated by finding all the cards linked to the card with the given nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose cards are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of CardClient objects representing the cards linked to the card with the given nickname.

    • getTable

      public HashMap<String,CardClient> getTable()
      This method returns the table of the game. The table is represented by a HashMap where the key is the player's nickname and the value is a CardClient object representing the starting card of the player.
      Returns:
      the table of the game.
